data.event: Thornton is first mentioned in 1086 in the Domesday Book, where it was referred to as Torentum.

event.title: covered a large area including what are now

data.event: At the time it covered a large area including what are now Cleveleys and Fleetwood, and had a very low population density.
The area remained lightly populated until 1799, when the marshland around the village was drained and agricultural production began on a large scale.
A railway station was opened in Thornton in 1865.

event.title: became an Urban District Council in 1900

data.event: Thornton became an Urban District Council in 1900, surviving until 1974 when it became part of the Wyre Borough Council.
